comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
The XAT-6E, fitted with a Ranger inverted V-12 engine, which was designed for efficiency at higher altitudes than the normal R-1340 installation. The aircraft was a standard AT-6D, serial 42-84241, before conversion. The engine proved its worth at altitude, but the overall improvement in performance was insufficient to put into production. In the postwar racing era, ex-WASP pilot Mickey McGrath flew the aircraft in the Halle Trophy race.

Doug MacPhail
